{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524098,"name":"Mason ","username":"9453_MSH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T22:30:32.086Z","cooked":"

When we connect to our CAN bus, either through our Spark MAX directly or through our PDH, we experience connectivity issues. We either have no connection at all, or we briefly connect to everything in our loop for one second before losing the connection. Additionally, if we connect directly to our Spark MAX, it won’t run the motor, even when using the REV Hardware Client to command movement. We’ve thoroughly checked all our wiring and haven’t found any issues. We also have a Pigeon 2.0 in the CAN chain.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-11T22:30:32.086Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":65.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491256,"topic_slug":"can-loop-error","display_username":"Mason ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71720,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-loop-error/491256/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3524118,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T23:01:36.700Z","cooked":"

Is the PDH at one end of the CAN bus? Is it configured to have a terminating resistor? If you disconnect your CAN wires at both ends, does each have a low resistance? If you disconnect one end only, what is the resistance between them? What do the status lights on the PDH and Spark MAX show?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-11T23:01:36.700Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":18.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491256,"topic_slug":"can-loop-error","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/hardware/hardware-basics/status-lights-ref.html#spark-max-motor-controller","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Status Light Quick Reference — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":0},{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/hardware/hardware-basics/status-lights-ref.html#pdh-status-led","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Status Light Quick Reference — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/can-loop-error/491256/2","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3525404,"name":"Mason ","username":"9453_MSH","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/9/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T21:58:17.722Z","cooked":"

The PDH is at the end of the CAN bus and configured with a terminating resistor. One end has low resistance, and the other has high resistance. The status on the PDH is green, there is no status light on the RIO, the Spark Max is flashing blue, and our Pigeon 2.0 is alternating orange.

When we entered the robotics room today, all devices reappeared on our REV hardware. However, we still can’t manually control our Spark Max motors.

The original problem is fixed, but if you could provide any insight on our original issue, that would be greatly appreciated to prevent this from happening in the future.

Are you trying to control the SPARK Max with the Rio still on the bus? They can only be controlled on Hardware Client when the Rio is not connected through CAN to the controller.
